civilopediaText.text: What are The Paths

All technologies from the Ancient Era and the tech groups enabling entry into the Classical Era upon discovering the first researchable Classical tech constitute the sample of available choices. The sequence of selecting these technologies passively determines a corresponding path, with each path providing distinct bonuses.
Only the first selected technology in each column of the tech tree determines the path direction, not the second or third.
There are 28 paths with 196 selection patterns, derived from the arrangement of the first three columns of technologies (excluding the initial [Agriculture]) sufficient to advance to the Classical Era.
Upon entering the Classical Era, the path becomes permanently locked and unchangeable.
Paths are represented as three-digit codes corresponding to the three path-determining technologies.
Hundreds digit: 
1→[Pottery] 2→[Animal Husbandry] 3→[Archery] 4→[Mining]
Double digit: 
1→[Sailing] 2→[Calendar] 3→[Writing] 4→[Trapping] 5→[The Wheel] 6→[Masonry] 7→[Bronze Working]
Single digits: 
1→[Optics] 2→[Philosophy] 3→[Drama and Poetry] 4→[Horseback Riding] 5→[Mathematics] 6→[Construction] 7→[Iron Working]
